sources.title: PARLONS GRAND-MÈRE 1989 Restored Version With English Subtitles
sources.description: PARLONS GRAND-MÈRE Directed by Djibril Diop Mambéty Senegal, 1989 Documentary, Short 34 min. Synopsis Djibril Diop Mambéty followed and filmed the shooting of “Yaaba”, Idrissa Ouédraogo’s (Burkina Faso, 1989) second feature film. A documentary full of humorous anecdotes regarding the dangers of shooting in Burkina Faso. Fifteen years after "Touki Bouki", Djibril Diop Mambéty gets back behind the camera to film two things that are close to his heart: cinema and children. The cinema, to which he pays a sensitive tribute here, is that of his young friend Idrissa Ouedraogo, who is currently shooting Yaaba, his second feature film.
